file_content.text: I knew Corellia would join us sooner or later. Good work.
Thanks to you, the resistance in Labor Valley's trounced. The rebels too stupid to surrender are falling like flies.
Wish you could stay and wipe 'em out, but the forces that be want you in Axial Park. Good luck.
The Selonians are rebuilding the resistance. Take to their tunnels, and hit them where it counts.
Good work hitting the rebels' weapons shipments. Darth Decimus is expecting our report.
Major, Councillor... and my good friend. What news on the rebel supplies?
Major Tradik... Darbin Sull... and my good friends. What of the rebel supplies?
Destroyed, my lord. The resistance in Labor Valley is defeated.
That's not entirely accurate. Their weapons are in flames, but the rebellion here's still kicking.
I'm aware of their persistence, Councillor. Intelligence monitored the rebels' retreat. They slithered into the tunnels beneath Coronet City, like the worms they are.
The rebels are pinned down. Those tunnels will be their grave.
They can't escape me.
Assuredly, my lord, but the insurgents will find help. Those tunnels are Selonian territory.
Hunting the rebels will be simple. I'll just follow the stink of their fear.
They can't escape me.
It won't be long 'til they muster courage, my lord. Those tunnels are Selonian territory.
Let them run. I'll track the rebels down and end their resistance.
They can't hide from me.
I wouldn't bet on a quick cleanup. Those tunnels are Selonian territory.
What tunnels?
Tunnels?
There's a network of underground pipelines. Rumor says they stretch kilometers beneath Coronet City. All of it Selonian territory.
We must defeat them quickly.
I wouldn't rush in without a plan. Those tunnels are Selonian territory.
If those furry aliens are part of the resistance, we'll blast them off Corellia!
Patience, Major. The Selonians are fierce warriors, and those tunnels are their nest. Your men wouldn't survive five minutes.
You don't know the half of it. I've seen holos of a gang that attacked the tunnels... clawed to pieces.
These creatures may challenge your street gangs, but they're no match for the Force.
I won't suffer the same fate.
Of course, my lord. But those tunnels are a maze, packed with the savage beasts. Best to keep your lightsaber drawn at all times.
Don't mistake me for a Corellian thug. I can handle these creatures.
I'll fare better.
I'm sure you will. But those tunnels are stuffed with the snarling beasts. Best not to lower your blaster in that maze.
The Selonians can't shake me.
That's why you're the hotshot, and I'm the public servant.
Thanks for the morale boost, Darbin. Exactly what I wanted to hear.
You're not raising my spirits.
Just keeping you informed. Of course, if I was in charge of Corellia, those tunnels would've been cleared out long ago.
The rebels are down there, collaborating with the Selonians. They're following the orders of Murthil, a vicious warrior, and the Selonians' den mother.
Her tunnels are the rebel's lifeline, moving troops and supplies beneath Coronet City. Take Murthil's lair and we'll fracture the rebellion.
The Selonian tunnels will soon belong to the Empire.
Murthil is finished.
Storm the Selonian warren and deal with them. Once you're in, Imperial forces will cut off their escape.
The more troops join me underground, the quicker the Selonians fall.
I could use some backup.
The tunnels were built to deflect an invading force. Only after you've dealt with the Selonians can our forces flank them.
If it must be done, I'm in.
March into the Selonian tunnels, cut down the rebels and deal with Murthil. Once you're in, Imperial forces will cut off their escape.
As for you, Darbin--I require your unique perspective elsewhere. Take the first rocket tram to Axial Park. Await my orders.
Right away, my lord. Corellia's prime minister-to-be is happy to serve.
Domesticate the Selonians or kill them. May the dark side guide you.
The Empire's grip on Corellia is tightening. Crush the Selonians, and our victory will be that much closer.
The rebel weapons shipments are stopped permanently. The resistance is broken.
Good show. See what a little elbow grease can do, Major?
Can it, Darbin. Darth Decimus will want to hear this.
Smash the rebels' supplies. I'll hold the fort down.
Welcome to the blitz, my lord. Darth Decimus told me you'd be gracing us with your presence.
Welcome to the blitz, sir. Darth Decimus said to roll out the red carpet, but I wasn't expecting such an esteemed operative.
Welcome to the blitz, hunter. Darth Decimus said we'd be receiving your services.
Darth Decimus said you'd be coming. Welcome to the blitz.
What we've got here's a cleanup operation. Factories were moving massive amounts of supplies to rebels across Corellia. Bomber brigades came in.
We rained fire on their heads, ripped the factories apart. We just need to beat down the rebels hiding out inside.
Sith don't bother with table scraps, Major.
This is beneath me.
Understood, my lord. But these rebels are stubborn and armed to the teeth. Darth Decimus knew we'd need your powers to finish them.
Eliminating the weak hardly requires my talents.
This is beneath me.
Noted, sir. But these rebels are far from weak. Darth Decimus knew we'd need your talents to finish them.
I hunt big game. Not injured rebels.
This is beneath me.
Those rebels may be hurt, but they're stubborn and well-armed. Darth Decimus knew we'd need your skills to finish 'em.
Such decisiveness is exactly why the Empire will win Corellia.
Good work, Major.
I'm honored to serve. Unfortunately, I've had to deal with some unsavory company in the process.
Nothing like a bombing run to crush their spirit. You're making my job easier.
Good work, Major.
Much appreciated. I'll tell you, it wasn't easy considering the company I had to work with.
You haven't attacked them yet?
My boys are in the field, but the enemy's tearing them apart. Now that you're here, we can revise our attack.
We're getting intel from an inside source. Unfortunately, his dalliances with the local women make him perpetually late.
Manners, Major Tradik. We all have our vices.
I'm sorry--we haven't met. I'm Darbin Sull, Corellia's top councillor, friend to the Empire. I hope the major hasn't dirtied my reputation.
I hear you're feeding us intel on the rebels.
He said you're on our side.
Why is a Corellian aiding the Empire?
Why are you helping us?
I've always been a firm supporter of the Empire. And the promise to become Corellia's prime minister didn't hurt.
I don't need someone to tell me you're a selfish, corrupt dog.
You look dirty enough as is.
I'm used to veiled insults. I suppose I appreciate the candor, but don't be so quick to judge.
I have friends, no... acquaintances... in the resistance. I pretend I'm sympathetic to their fight, they tell me things--like who's supplying them.
Certain factories were churning out military-grade munitions, battle droids, you name it--all donated right to the resistance across the Core Worlds.
That's why we bombed those factories into an inferno.
Not quite the subtle approach I hoped for. The bombardment trapped the rebels in the burning wreckage. Now they're angry, desperate and sitting on the largest weapons stockpile in the Core.
If the rebels get those weapons functional, we may as well abandon Corellia.
I'll crush the rebels' hoard.
Leave their weapons to me.
I'll burn their weapons to cinders. Then those rebel worms will be ripe for squashing.
Leave their weapons to me.
I'll dispose of the rebels' salvage and break up their little movement.
Leave their weapons to me.
The rebels will be easy prey once I destroy their stockpiles.
Leave their weapons to me.
Watch and learn, Major.
Those Corellians fight dirty. Whatever munitions they've got have downed every squad sent their way.
You'll do better. Just wipe out their weaponry. If I know my people, they'll bow to the Empire once their hope is crushed.
Fine. I'll keep those rebels busy myself.
We'll light up this whole city to burn out the rebels.
If I must.
